item.title: Container Network Interface plugin
item.description: Kubernetes does not implement such things as mulit-host networking (i.e. Pod-to-Pod communication across nodes). The Container Network Interface (CNI) is a framework for dynamically configuring network resources.

item.title: Network policies
item.description: Kubernetes Network policies are an application-centric construct which allow you to specify how a pod is allowed to communicate with various network “entities” (endpoints, services) over the network.

item.title: OSI model layers
item.description: OSI stands for Open Systems Interconnection. It is a 7-layer architecture with each layer having specific functionality to perform. All these 7 layers work collaboratively to transmit the data from one perso to another across the globe.

item.title: Security group
item.description: A security group acts as a firewall that controls the traffic allowed to and from the resources in your virtual private cloud (VPC).
